item.title: llm4s.g8 â€“ A Developer experience boost for LLM4S SDK (Issue #94)
item.description:
ðŸŽ¯ Background

llm4s: Github repo

In the rapidly evolving landscape of software development, where artificial intelligence and language models are reshaping how we build applications, the LLM4S SDK stands out as a powerful toolkit for Scala developers eager to harness the potential of large language models. However, as with many sophisticated tools, the initial onboarding experience can often feel like navigating a labyrinth without a map. This was precisely the challenge highlighted in Issue #94 on the llm4s GitHub repo :

item.title: My Road to Google Developer Expert (GDE): A hands-on guide from an Engineer who walked the path
item.description:
If you’re reading this, youâ€™re probably thinking of applying for the Google Developer Expert (GDE) program - or at least curious what it takes. Iâ€™ve walked that path. This post is a no-BS breakdown of my journey, including what worked, what didnâ€™t, and what surprised me along the way.

ðŸ§­ Why I Chose the GDE Path

For me, GDE wasnâ€™t about a title - it was about recognizing and amplifying the work I was already doing. Iâ€™ve been in the engineering game for 12+ years - data pipelines, architecture, tooling, open source, mentoring - and the GDE program felt like a natural next step to formalize those contributions.

item.title: DQ Is Not Dairy Queen: Building My Own Data Quality Framework
item.description:
ðŸ¦ DQ â‰  Ice Cream

When someone hears â€œDQ Framework,â€ I get asked if it comes with sprinkles. It doesnâ€™t. It comes with sanity-saving data validations, automatable quality checks, and opinionated constraints that donâ€™t melt under pressure.

So no, this isnâ€™t about Dairy Queen. But it does prevent frozen pipelines. â„ï¸

ðŸ’¡ Why I Built It

Every data engineer has been there:

  • A critical job runs on time… and writes garbage.
  • Downstream dashboards look suspiciously optimistic.
  • Stakeholders smile because they donâ€™t know 18% of yesterdayâ€™s rows are NULL.

I couldnâ€™t keep slapping WHERE col IS NOT NULL forever. So I built a reusable, testable Data Quality Framework ( DQF) and paired it with a Declarative Pipeline Assurance Tool (DPAT).
